name: hazard
structure: Produces entries for different types of genres and worlds. The 'common' and 'rare' tables are generic and should be compatible with almost any world. To retain compatibility with most settings, the  non-generic tables should be called only from other tables by specifying their name directly.

tables.name: air
entries: A poisonous cloud fills the area. [Damages anyone breathing the gas.]
A swarm of stinging insects infest the area. [Affects movement.]
A swarm of biting insects infest the area. [Affects movement.]
A huge swarm of insects cloud this place. [Affects senses.]
A thick cloud of {gas} sears nostrils and blocks vision. [Affects offense and senses.]
Laughing gas [nitrous oxide] permeates this area. [Affects senses.]
Air is filled with explosive {gaseous explosive}. [Affects offense.]

tables.name: ceiling
entries: At random, {ceiling dropping} fall from the ceiling. [Affects offense.]

tables.name: floor
entries: Large pools of mud {dice:1d12} feet deep scatter the area. [Affects movement.]
Small pools of mud {dice:1d3+1} feet deep dot the area. [Affects movement.]
Large chunks of broken stone litter the area. [Affects movement.]
Small chunks of broken stone litter the area. [Affects movement.]
Debris scattered around makes footing difficult. [Affects movement.]
Berms of deep snow {dice:1d5+1} feet deep have built up here. [Affects movement.]
Slimy patches of writhing slugs litter the area. [Affects movement.]
Snakes cover the area. [Affects movement and offense.]
Hard shelled nuts cover the floor in places. [Affects movement.]
Several open graves present open-hole dangers in this place. [Affects movement.]
Deep snow covers the floor making it hard and slow to walk around. [Affects movement.]
Weak spots on the floor could drop victims into sinkholes or other locations below. [Affects movement.]
{dice:1d4} large bear-traps are primed and ready to snap shut on unfortunate victims. [Affects offense.]
Soft spots on the floor hamper movement and twist ankles. [Affects movement and offense.]
The floor is slick from {slippery substance}. [Affects movement.]
The floor is slick with {rare slippery substance}. [Affects movement and offense.]
Small pools of hot glue dot the floor. The glue dries fast once it cools. [Affects movement and senses.]
Large pools of hot glue dot the floor. The glue dries fast once it cools. [Affects movement and senses.]

tables.name: general
entries: Random static discharges target the tallest or greatest concentration of metal. [Affects offense.]

tables.name: sensory
entries: A loud roaring makes it difficult to hear. [Affects senses.]
A piercing horn painfully blocks hearing. [Affects offense and senses.]
Thunder so loud periodically booms and knocks things flat. [Affects movement, offense and senses.]

tables.name: wall
entries: A wall is covered by sharp spikes. [Causes additional damage for anyone fumbling near.]

tables.name: myth
tables.explanation: Hazards once rumoured to have existed.
entries: Magical darkness obscures part of this area. [Affects senses.]
Magical darkness obscures the entire area. [Affects senses.]

tables.name: fantasy
tables.explanation: Hazards for fantasy worlds (with no basis in myth).
entries: A wall of fire fire blocks the passage. [Causes burn damage to anyone attempting to pass.]

tables.name: modern
entries: A biohazard contaminates the area. [Anypone entering the area risks virus infection.]

tables.name: futuristic
entries: A force field blocks the passage.
